meanings.definition: The increase in the electrical charge across a cell membrane, making the inside more negative.
meanings.sent1: During hyperpolarization, the cell's interior becomes even more negative.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study hyperpolarization to understand how cells change their charge.
meanings.sent3: The hyperpolarization of the cell made it the grumpiest one in the body.
meanings.sent4: Her mood experienced a hyperpolarization, becoming darker and more distant.
meanings.sent5: The hyperpolarization of the cell was like a storm brewing inside.
